_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The qualities of the blind person [an3.2: Lack of vision to acquire more wealth or to increase the wealth they’ve already acquired
Lack of vision to know the difference between qualities that are skillful and unskillful, blameworthy and blameless, inferior and superior, and those on the side of dark and bright
The qualities of the person with one eye: Vision to acquire more wealth and to increase the wealth they’ve already acquired
Lack of vision to know the difference between qualities that are skillful and unskillful, blameworthy and blameless, inferior and superior, and those on the side of dark and bright
The qualities of the person with two eye: Vision to acquire more wealth and to increase the wealth they’ve already acquired
Vision to know the difference between qualities that are skillful and unskillful, blameworthy and blameless, inferior and superior, and those on the side of dark and bright
The actions and consequences of the one-: Seeks wealth by methods good and bad
Skilled at piling up money and enjoying sensual pleasures
The actions and consequences of the two-: Earns wealth legitimately through hard work
Goes to a good place where there is no sorrow
